byline.original: By MAHER SAMAAN and ANNE BARNARD

abstract: Airstrikes and bombardments by Syrian government against insurgents in Douma and other cities across country are destroying neighborhoods and upending life for residents; physical damage and civilian casualties caused by Pres Bashar al-Assad's government forces far outweighs that of rebels; four out of five residents of Douma have fled city.
lead_paragraph: In cities like Douma, a suburb of Damascus, routine strikes have forced residents to flee and severely disrupted life for those who are unable to.

headline.main: For Those Who Remain in Syria, Daily Life Is a Nightmare
headline.print_headline: All Over Syria, Enduring a Daily Nightmare

snippet: In cities like Douma, a suburb of Damascus, routine strikes have forced residents to flee and severely disrupted life for those who are unable to.
